name: The power of alternate endings
description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

key_work.title: The Power of Love
key_work.creator_credit: Harry K. Fairall and Nat G. Deverich
key_work.brief_description: The first feature 3D motion picture screened for a commercial audience was The Power of Love (1922), which used the red-and-green anaglyph system that most people associate with 3D. Audiences looked through red-and-green glasses at two film strips, recorded and projected in each colour.

constellations_primary.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

start.title: Breaking Bad
start.creator_credit: Sam Catlin, Melissa Bernstein, John Shiban, Patty Lin, Diane Mercer, Bryan Cranston, Moira Walley-Beckett, Karen Moore, Stewart Lyons, Thomas Schnauz, George Mastras, Peter Gould, Kathleen Detoro, Robb Wilson King, Sony Pictures Television Studios, High Bridge Entertainment and Gran Via Productions
start.brief_description: When Walter White, a New Mexico chemistry teacher, is diagnosed with Stage III cancer and given a prognosis of only two years left to live. He becomes filled with a sense of fearlessness and an unrelenting desire to secure his family’s financial future at any cost as he enters the dangerous world of drugs and crime.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

end.title: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie
end.creator_credit: Aaron Paul, Vince Gilligan, Melissa Bernstein, Charles Newirth, Mark Johnson, Sony Pictures Television Studios, Gran Via Productions, High Bridge Entertainment, Louise Frogley and Judy Rhee

video_links.name: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie | Official Trailer | Netflix

end.brief_description: In the wake of his dramatic escape from captivity, Jesse Pinkman must come to terms with his past in order to forge some kind of future.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: Like fans weren’t ready to say goodbye to Alf, nor were Breaking Bad fans ready to say goodbye to Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul), who got his own Netflix movie spin-off.

start.title: The Power of Love
start.creator_credit: Harry K. Fairall and Nat G. Deverich
start.brief_description: The first feature 3D motion picture screened for a commercial audience was The Power of Love (1922), which used the red-and-green anaglyph system that most people associate with 3D. Audiences looked through red-and-green glasses at two film strips, recorded and projected in each colour.

constellations_primary.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

end.title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
end.creator_credit: Russell McLean, House of Tomorrow, David Slade, Caroline Harris, Charlie Brooker and Catrin Meredydd
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
end.brief_description: In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a dark fantasy novel into a video game. A mind-bending tale with multiple endings.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: The Power of Love was the first 3D film, which used the red-and-green anaglyph system. Audiences could choose different endings by peering through only the red or green lens. Black Mirror: Bandersnatch also had alternate endings powered by an algorithm.

start.title: Black Mirror: Bandersnatch
start.creator_credit: Russell McLean, House of Tomorrow, David Slade, Caroline Harris, Charlie Brooker and Catrin Meredydd
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2018
start.brief_description: In 1984, a young programmer begins to question reality as he adapts a dark fantasy novel into a video game. A mind-bending tale with multiple endings.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

end.title: Mr. Robot
end.brief_description: A young programmer, Elliot, suffers from a debilitating anti-social disorder and finds himself in the intersection between the cybersecurity firm he works for and the underworld organisations bringing down corporate America.

constellations_other.name: Hack the planet
constellations_other.description: How do you represent something that's... kinda boring to look at, like hacking, when you're operating in a visual medium like film, TV and videogames?

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

links.description: Bandersnatch presents a meta-narrative with themes of control and staying in touch with reality, much like Sam Esmail’s dystopian hacker TV show Mr Robot. The second season slogan was ‘Control is an illusion’.

end.title: ALF
end.creator_credit: Paul Fusco, Bernie Brillstein and Alien Productions
end.brief_description: A furry alien wiseguy comes to live with a terran family after crashing into their garage.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: Episode six of season two of Mr Robot features a sequence where protagonist Elliot(Academy Award-winner Rami Malek) dreams of being in a low-budget sitcom, featuring a cameo from late-80s sitcom mascot Alf.

end.title: Breaking Bad
end.creator_credit: Sam Catlin, Melissa Bernstein, John Shiban, Patty Lin, Diane Mercer, Bryan Cranston, Moira Walley-Beckett, Karen Moore, Stewart Lyons, Thomas Schnauz, George Mastras, Peter Gould, Kathleen Detoro, Robb Wilson King, Sony Pictures Television Studios, High Bridge Entertainment and Gran Via Productions
end.brief_description: When Walter White, a New Mexico chemistry teacher, is diagnosed with Stage III cancer and given a prognosis of only two years left to live. He becomes filled with a sense of fearlessness and an unrelenting desire to secure his family’s financial future at any cost as he enters the dangerous world of drugs and crime.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: Alf ran for four season in the late 80s, with a spin-off talk show produced with Alf as host. It only lasted seven episodes, but it featured some notable guests, including Bryan Cranston, would later star in prestige TV hit Breaking Bad.

start.title: Breaking Bad
start.creator_credit: Sam Catlin, Melissa Bernstein, John Shiban, Patty Lin, Diane Mercer, Bryan Cranston, Moira Walley-Beckett, Karen Moore, Stewart Lyons, Thomas Schnauz, George Mastras, Peter Gould, Kathleen Detoro, Robb Wilson King, Sony Pictures Television Studios, High Bridge Entertainment and Gran Via Productions

end.title: The Eric Andre Show

video_links.name: The Eric Andre Show Season 5 (Official Trailer) | October 25 @ Midnight | adult swim

end.brief_description: A comedic talk show from an alternate reality featuring unstable hosts, a variety of celebrities—both real and fake—and unusual studio action.

constellations_other.name: The power of alternate endings
constellations_other.description: This Constellation about alternate perspectives, dream states, sitcoms and spin-offs was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

links.description: The Eric Andre Show is billed as a talk show from “another reality”, much like the other realities and mental states explored in shows like Bandersnatch and Mr Robot. Breaking Bad alum Krysten Ritter appeared as a guest on this parody talk show.

links.description: Like El Camino was a standalone continution of a popular series, Bandersnatch was one of Black Mirror. Both debuted on Netflix.
